sentences.english: He was capable of bringing out an expurgated edition of Wordsworth .
sentences.chinese: 他几乎做得出出版华兹华斯作品的删改本。

sentences.english: Your love is too easy to sell, the next instant to deletion.
sentences.chinese: 你的感情太易割爱，把未来转眼就删改。

sentences.english: Added or withdrawn from their intial diagnosis to the current consultation.
sentences.chinese: 对最初诊断进行补充或删改，提出当前的诊治意见。

sentences.english: Most children read an expurgated version of Grimms' fairy tales.
sentences.chinese: 大多数孩子们读格林童话的删改本。

sentences.english: Contributions will not be revised except for some technical treatment.
sentences.chinese: △本刊对来稿除进行技术性的处理外，一般不作删改。

sentences.english: His talk was red-penciled before it got clearance.
sentences.chinese: 他的谈话经过删改后才准予发表。

sentences.english: Bad translation mutilates the original work.
sentences.chinese: 拙劣的译本将原作删改得支离破碎。

sentences.english: The interview has been edited for length and clarity.
sentences.chinese: 以下采访的内容因篇幅和清晰度有所删改。

sentences.english: She's pruning down the novel at the publisher's request.
sentences.chinese: 她按出版商的要求对小说进行删改。

sentences.english: The editor hacked my article to bits.
sentences.chinese: 编辑把我的文章删改得面目全非。

sentences.english: The draft was revised several times before it was finalized.
sentences.chinese: 稿子几经删改才定下来。

definition: to abridge (a text)/to edit out (of a movie)/to cut back (a budget, a curriculum)
to abridge/to cut a text down to size for publication
to cut (from a movie etc)/to censor
